conclusion: To answer the question, we need to analyze how the movement of the light source to the back right will affect the shadows (A, B, C, and D) of the four objects.
Shadows are formed when light is blocked by objects.
The direction of the light source determines the direction of the shadows.

premise: If the light source moves to the back right of the objects, the shadows will shift in the opposite direction.
conclusion: The shadows will shift towards the front left.

premise: The shadow of the Apple will move towards the front left.
